Good Guy In Real Life! 'Joker' Star Joaquin Phoenix Tracks Down Driver Of The Truck He'd Hit, Owns Up To His Mistake

Good Guy In Real Life! 'Joker' Star Joaquin Phoenix Tracks Down Driver Of The Truck He'd Hit, Owns Up To His Mistake

Joaquin Phoenix might have played the villainous role of Joker on the big screen but he ain’t bad in real life. Instead, he just proved that he is indeed an incredibly nice guy in real life.

Joaquin Phoenix had reportedly hit a parked vehicle. What did he do then? He tracked down the driver to confess his fault.

Twitter

The 44-year-old actor was in his Tesla, when it ran into the bumper of Los Angeles County Fire Department truck, according to TMZ. Joaquin Phoenix had apparently misjudged a right turn he was making. That can happen to anyone, right? But how he reacted to the entire incident was a rarity. What he did after that has restored our faith in humanity.

interviewmagazine.com

His Tesla had born most of the damage, while the truck just had minor scratches, it is said. But even then, Joaquin Phoenix went out of his way to find the paramedics in order to explain the situation to them.

Not only that, he waited until the police were called and was cordial and easy to deal with when everyone exchanged insurance information and a damage report was filed. That’s how one is supposed to behave, right?

Twitter

Meanwhile, Joaquin Phoenix’s Joker is receiving rave reviews all over the globe and people are loving his stellar performance which is also being compared to Heath Ledger’s iconic and untouched portrayal of Joker in The Dark Knight.

However, there are also discussions on the possibility of Joaquin Phoenix’s role inspiring mass shooting. When at an interview, he was asked about the same, Joaquin Phoenix walked out of the interview.

celebs-place.com

"Aren’t you worried that this film might perversely end up inspiring exactly the kind of people it’s about, with potentially tragic results?", the journalist from The Telegraph UK had asked him.

"'Why would you…? No… no.'" said Joaquin Phoenix and then walked out of the interview, reportedly.
